comment: With the right counsel, witnesses, strategy, and support, the fact that James Fields is innocent may very well shine through in the courtroom. Our side is too quick to pre-emptively accept defeats when faced with what seem like insurmountable odds. When you believe the other side is invincible, you become an unwitting agent of defeat. They're not.
amr:
# ::snt With the right counsel, witnesses, strategy, and support, the fact that James Fields is innocent may very well shine through in the courtroom. Our side is too quick to pre-emptively accept defeats when faced with what seem like insurmountable odds. When you believe the other side is invincible, you become an unwitting agent of defeat. They're not.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (p / possible-01
            :ARG1 (s / shine-01
                  :ARG1 (ii / innocent-01
                        :ARG1 (p2 / person
                              :name (n / name
                                    :op1 "James"
                                    :op2 "Fields")))
                  :ARG2 (t / through)
                  :location (c / courtroom)
                  :mod (w / well
                        :degree (v / very)))
            :condition (a / and
                  :op1 (c2 / counsel-01
                        :ARG1-of (r / right-03))
                  :op2 (p3 / person
                        :ARG0-of (w2 / witness-01))
                  :op3 (s2 / strategy)
                  :op4 (s3 / support-01)))
      :snt2 (h / have-degree-91
            :ARG1 (s4 / side
                  :poss (w3 / we))
            :ARG2 (q / quick-02
                  :ARG1 s4
                  :ARG1-of (c3 / cause-01
                        :ARG0 ii))
            :ARG3 (t2 / too)
            :ARG6 (a2 / accept-01
                  :ARG0 s4
                  :ARG1 (d / defeat-01
                        :ARG0 s4)
                  :time (f / face-01
                        :ARG0 s4
                        :ARG1 (t3 / thing
                              :ARG1-of (s5 / seem-01
                                    :ARG2 (ii2 / insurmountable
                                          :ARG1-of (p4 / possible-01
                                                :polarity -)))))))
      :snt3 (h2 / have-polarity-91
            :ARG1 (t4 / they)
            :ARG2 -)
      :snt4 (b / become-01
            :ARG1 (y / you)
            :ARG2 (a3 / agent
                  :ARG0-of (e / enable-01
                        :polarity -
                        :ARG1 (d2 / defeat-01)))
            :time (b2 / believe-01
                  :ARG0 y
                  :ARG1 (ii3 / invincible
                        :domain (s6 / side
                              :mod (o / other))))))

comment: One of the biggest post-Cville blackpills is watching most of the movement treat James like he's radioactive material. There is so much evidence in his favor. This case is winnable. And it'd do much for both James and movement morale if we expressed support for him, even in small ways.
amr:
# ::snt One of the biggest post-Cville blackpills is watching most of the movement treat James like he's radioactive material. There is so much evidence in his favor. This case is winnable. And it'd do much for both James and movement morale if we expressed support for him, even in small ways.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (w / watch-01
            :ARG1 (t / treat-01
                  :ARG0 (p / person
                        :ARG1-of (ii / include-91
                              :ARG2 (m2 / movement)
                              :ARG3 (m3 / most)))
                  :ARG1 (p2 / person
                        :name (n / name
                              :op1 "James"))
                  :ARG2 (m4 / material
                        :mod (r / radioactive)
                        :domain p2))
            :ARG1-of (ii2 / include-91
                  :ARG2 (b / blackpill
                        :time (a / after
                              :op1 (c / city
                                    :name (n2 / name
                                          :op1 "Cville")))
                        :ARG1-of (h / have-degree-91
                              :ARG2 (b2 / big)
                              :ARG3 (m5 / most)))))
      :snt2 (e / evidence-01
            :ARG1 (f / favor-01
                  :ARG1 (h2 / he))
            :ARG1-of (h3 / have-quant-91
                  :ARG2 (m6 / much)
                  :ARG3 (s / so)))
      :snt3 (w2 / win-01
            :ARG1 (c2 / case-03
                  :mod (t2 / this)))
      :snt4 (a2 / and
            :op2 (d / do-02
                  :ARG0 (ii3 / it)
                  :ARG1 m6)
            :ARG2 (a3 / and
                  :op1 (m7 / morale
                        :poss (p3 / person
                              :name (n3 / name
                                    :op1 "James")))
                  :op2 (m8 / morale
                        :poss (m9 / movement)))
            :condition (e2 / express-01
                  :ARG0 (w3 / we)
                  :ARG1 (s2 / support-01
                        :ARG0 w3
                        :ARG1 (h4 / he)
                        :manner (w4 / way
                              :mod (s3 / small))))))

comment: Hey, don't say things like that, there's no need for that kind of language, simply saying "at least one person" would have been fine.
amr:
# ::snt Hey, don't say things like that, there's no need for that kind of language, simply saying "at least one person" would have been fine.
(a / and
      :op1 (s / say-01
            :polarity -
            :mode imperative
            :ARG0 (y / you)
            :ARG1 (t / thing
                  :ARG1-of (r / resemble-01
                        :ARG2 (t2 / that))))
      :op2 (n / need-01
            :polarity -
            :ARG1 (l / language
                  :mod (k / kind
                        :mod (t3 / that))))
      :op3 (f / fine-04
            :ARG1 (s2 / say-01
                  :ARG1 (p / person
                        :quant (a2 / at-least
                              :op1 1))
                  :ARG1-of (s3 / simple-02)))
      :mod (h / hey
            :mode expressive))

comment: Gender is a category that shouldn’t be the basis of an insult or disparagement.  It’s a lazy flex.
amr:
# ::snt Gender is a category that shouldn’t be the basis of an insult or disparagement.  It’s a lazy flex.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (r / recommend-01
            :polarity -
            :ARG1 (b / base-02
                  :ARG1 (o / or
                        :op1 (ii / insult-01)
                        :op2 (d / disparage-01))
                  :ARG2 (c / category
                        :domain (g / gender))))
      :snt2 (f / flex
            :mod (l / lazy)
            :domain (ii2 / it)))
